intro: Galium luteum var. trachyphyllum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered with fine, rough hairs. This variant is distinguished by its rough, textured stems and is often found in temperate regions with high humidity.
